nodes.bodyText: should we use Deprecated for naming consistency?
I've updated the method name from selectInvalidContainers to selectInvalidContainerCandidates which stands for select all containers which will be marked as Invalid during this aggregation cycle.
OK. It means you select DELETE_IN_PROGRESS and mark it as INACTIVE in the end.
you probably didn't push the latest branch, this is still there

I am a little bit confused about the naming here.
In last PR, deprecated includes INACTIVE and DELETE_IN_PROGRESS , right?
I've updated the name from deprecatedContainerSet to deleteInProgressContainerSet which include all containers marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS.
pass in accountService here is a little bit weird. I am think if any other solution..
@jsjtzyy   do you have any recommendation for this? I hope we don't add AccountService to Cluster related classes.
Let me think it through. Probably add a listener?
Please refer to partitionStateChangeListeners in HelixParticipant. If we want to decouple AccountService from ClusterParticipant, we can add another type of listener, i.e TaskCompletionListener.
After second thought, maybe TaskCompletionCallback makes more sense, because the purpose to pass in account service is to update account in ZK after the task is done and result is ready to read.
Updated. I use callback interface and implement accountServiceCallback to decouple accountService from clusterParticipant.
This still looks like a synchronous way to call some methods from accountService.  Try to initiate another thread to unblock current thread.

Inside selectInvalidContainersAndMarkInZK I have two main method, I was trying to start a new thread for markContainerZkNodesInactive, but this update will be include in another PR, so I marked as TODO. But for selectInvalidContainerCandidates() I thought it's ok to run at current thread as we discussed. Please correct me if I'm wrong.

OK, that makes sense. I saw the TODO but didn't know how you will implement it. The plan sounds good to me, the remaining thing is, like @zzmao said, whether we should pass in accountService to this component. If we decide to decouple them, we can either use a listener or callback.
We usually don't import external dependency (i.e. Guava), unless there is really needed.

Replace this with:
Objects.requireNonNull(keyName, "keyName should not be null since every container will have it's corresponding accountId");
Since you have a return in if branch, you can move this piece of code out of else branch.
Suggest renaming this method, as it doesn't return anything. Also, Valid is a bit of ambiguous here. Maybe we call it searchNonEmptyContainers
In which case, this else will happen? I think we shouldn't recursively call this method here. Let me know if I am wrong.

I'm thinking that if for the future we probably will have multiple level of subMap under container level. For example like separate the statsReport by month, so with this it will quickly jump out of recursion. If you think it's unnecessary, please let me know. I can remove it.
Let's remove it for now. If we really need this, we can add later.
According to the comment and code logic, I would suggest changing Invalid to Inactive in this method. InactiveContainerCandidates sounds more reasonable
add a log here for debugging as well

Raw use of the Callback, change it to Callback<StatsSnapshot> ?
Also update the java doc of this constructor please.

nodes.bodyText: I know the exception doesn't affect the account service callback but others might don't. We can add logger.info here if exception is not null. We can say "Aggregator task encountered an exception but result is not null. Processing the result as aggregation is complete."   You can also add comment saying "Exception occurred when updating Helix property store, not in aggregation phase, the result is still solid."

nodes.bodyText: Looks like you imported a different type of Callback (should be account service callback not router callback).
the router callback is the interface, and I implement with account service callback. Let me know if I misunderstanding something.
After discussion, I moved the callback interface to commons dir which is more reasonable.
